title: Triangle Velo Winter Orange County Speedway Races
UNC-CH Presents the Chatham County Road Race
MAC Racing Series training clinic
description: Join USAC Coaches Sarah Matchet, Nick Able and members of the Race City Cycling Team for this 2 hour race specific skills sessions. This session is designed for anyone considering bike racing for the first time or those who just want to be more comfortable riding in a large group. The session will cover: basic pack skills, cornering and elements of pack awareness. Although this beginning racer session is focused on novice cyclists, all non-licensed (first-time racers) and male Cat. 5 /4 or female Cat. 4/3 racers are welcome to attend.
course: Clinic will be held on the GoPro Motorplex's .7 mile, 11 turn track located at 130 Motorplex Dr. in Mooresville, NC.
registration: Must register online to take part in this event. No registrations will be accepted on the day of the event.

title: SCS # 4 - Blue Ridge Mountain Bike Festival

Beech Bike Park Pro GRT
description:
USA Cycling Pro GRT returns to Beech Bike Park.  The following categories will be offered:

o	Pro: Men, Women
o	Cat 1: Men (9-18, 19-29, 30-39, 40+), Women
o	Cat 2: Men (9-14, 15-18, 19-29, 30-39, 40-49, 50+), Women (0-18, 19+)
o	Cat 3: Junior Men (9-14, 15-18), Men (19-39, 40-49, 50+), Women (9-18, 19+)
directions: 1007 Beech Mountain Parkway, Beech Mountain, NC 28604

title: Mars Hill Jr Devo Road Camp
description: A junior development camp for USAC riders racing age 10 to collegiate. It will be great prep for Junior Road Nationals and for any level junior looking to increase his or her skills, competitiveness, fitness, and fun on the bike.
course: Each day's ride focuses on a particular road event and the skillsets required: time trials, criteriums, road racing. Campers are split into groups depending on experience and ability. For elite juniors, we make sure they get the training/intensity they need. For younger or less experienced juniors, we make sure we give them the appropriate amount of riding without overdoing it. In addition, we have lectures on racing, training, nutrition, and equipment selection each evening given by top level USAC coaches and industry professionals.
registration: Please register here. Register by April 18th and receive a free custom Mars Hill University Cycling team jersey valued at over $100. http://www.pre-reg.com/Users/RacerMain.aspx?Type=1&EventID=902
notes:
BENEFITS:
• Riding in the beautiful mountains.
• All meals and training fuel provided.
• PowerTap wheels to demo.
• Free official Mars Hill University team jersey (If registered by April 18)
• USAC upgrade points for attending camp: 3pts if upgrading from 4-3
• Led by USAC certified coaches, national champions, and professionals.

TOPICS COVERED:
• Race strategy and tactics for individuals and teams
• Skills and bike handling sessions
• Racing and training with a power meter
• Endurance training plans and goal setting
• Race preparation, fueling, and recovery
• Aerodynamics, power-to-weight, and equipment selection
• Mechanics workshop covering maintenance and basic repair
• Core strength, flexibility, and proper bike fit
• Climbing, descending, sprinting, cornering, time trialing, attacking, bridging

STAFF and PRESENTERS: A variety of elite coaches, pro riders, and industry experts will lend their expertise throughout camp.
directions:
LODGING and LOCATION: Air conditioned rooms in Dogwood Hall.

Mars Hill University
100 Athletic Street
Mars Hill,  NC 28754

Directions to Camp: Our location is Dogwood Hall on the campus of Mars Hill University. From I-26 take exit 11. Go left at the stop sign or stoplight. Climb the hill to the first light at Main Street. Go through light and descend through campus, turning left onto Dormitory Rd. Take your first right and follow it around to the two-story brick building set at the base of the hill.

title: Queen City Cyclocross
description: Queen City Cyclocross Training Series presented by Slippery Sasquatch, Birdsong Brewing, and Legion Brewing teams. This will be a 4 race training series. Come out and hone your skills before NCCX kicks off. Races are $20. Second race fee is $5.
course: Races will be at Renaissance Park at 1200 West Tyvola Rd Charlotte NC 28217 on the soccer fields
registration: Save money and register online! $20 online registration fee; $25 registration fee on day of event. Non-USAC license holders will be required to purchase one-day USAC cycling license for each race ($10).  Riders can register for each race for just $5 per race.

Appalachian State University Mountain Bike Weekend
Durham Cycles 'Cross - BHB Cross Central NC Finale!
8th Honor the Warriors Bike Event 2017
description: 8th Annual Honor the Warriors Bike Event.  27th of October we will have a social/community ride through the greater Charlotte, NC Area.  We will visit an elementary school and a high school where we will stop for a lunch provided for all registrants.  The 28th of October we will have a more formalized ride beginning at Memorial Park in Mint Hill, NC.  Routes for this ride will be 15, 34, and 66 miles.  The ride will be followed by a BBQ for all registrants and time to meet the Warriors.
course: Course information may be found on "Ride with GPS" under HTW Rides
directions:
27th ride will begin at Eastway Park in Charlotte, NC,  https://www.google.com/maps/place/Eastway+Park/@35.255156,-80.7747837,15z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x0:0x9278821927c5d7df!8m2!3d35.255156!4d-80.7747837
the 28th ride will begin at Veteran's Memorial Park in Mint Hill, NC,  https://www.google.com/maps/place/Mint+Hill+Veterans+Memorial+Park/@35.1789702,-80.6336671,15z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x0:0xd974fd26294c1cdd!8m2!3d35.1789702!4d-80.6336671
Hope to see you all there!! Jerry

title: Ninja Mountain Bike Performance I (NC1028)
description: This camp is designed for the enthusiast rider or avid racer that is looking to build up and clean up their ‘toolbox’ of mountain bike skills in order to handle a variety of terrain at speed.
course: We will blend an in-depth version of our traditional Intermediate / Advanced skills training with coached riding sessions.

title: Collegiate CX Throwdown in the Carolinas - ACCC/SECCC

address.street: Salisbury Community Park, 935 Hurley School Rd

title: CX-mas at Spring Hill
description:
CX-mas at Spring Hill

A cyclocross race at everyone's favorite Raleigh venue.  We are mixing things up and throwing a slightly different cyclocross race. Gather around and spread the 'cross spirit and cheer. Holiday surprises, modified course, and tasty food truck. 

Additional Information can be found here http://bergerhardwarebikes.com/cxmas

All USA Cycling rules apply. All participants must fill out a USA Cycling Standard Athlete Release Form.

Bundle up have a blast with us all on December 2nd.
course: Re-engineered course for maximum fun and excitement!
registration:
Please register here on USAC. Day of will also be available, please bring cash or checks.

Registration is $25 (day of $30)
Juniors is $15
Bombers race is $10
Second race of the day is $10

Bombers Race - Please register day of. We will cover a one day license, if needed.

Let us know if online registration is causing any issues.
notes:
Thanks to a handful of sponsors, we have a solid lineup of prizes for the Juniors, 4/5, Single Speed, and Masters races. More prize information will follow.

Elite races purse is $300 each (equal payout for men and women)! Details below:
1st - $286 (!!!!)
2nd - New Balance shoes (you get to pick the pair online)
3rd to 15th - $1.
directions:
Please enter the following address into your favorite direction provider:
2212 Dorsett Dr, Raleigh, NC 27603
